title: Clos Henri 2015 Bel Echo Terroir: River Stones Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: Dry cedar, baking spices and ripe cherries emerge on the nose of this medium-bodied Pinot. It's a bit too marked by oak on the palate, but some will love the mix of vanilla and cedar and the dry woodiness on the finish.

title: Coffele 2015 Alzari  (Soave Classico)
description: Oak, toasted almond and ripe stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The ripe—almost syrupy—palate offers butterscotch, vanilla, mature yellow apple and confectionary notes while the almond tone gives it a bitter finish. It retains just enough fresh acidity to keep it from being cloying.

title: Contino 2015 White (Rioja)
description: Aromas of oak, buttered bread and apple are subdued. In the mouth, this feels ripe more than ripped, with mild acidity and not a lot of spine or structure. Flavors of oak, spice and apple fall quietly away on a simple finish.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2012 Bistro Red (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Veteran vintner Norman Beko blends 70% Pinot Noir with 30% Syrah to deliver wild berry, bay leaf, wet slate and sagebrush aromas in this bottling. The palate takes all those components and adds baked cranberry and thyme, making for an easily quaffable house wine.

title: Domaine Capmartin 2015 L'Instant Tannat-Cabernet (Madiran)
description: This estate in the valleys of Madiran has produced a delicious, fruity and entry-level wine. The tannins are just a part of the open generous red fruits and acidity to give a balanced wine that will be ready to drink quickly. Drink from 2018.

title: Harmony Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This ripe Chardonnay is a successful example of its style, with honeysuckle, white peach and marshmallow aromas on the nose. The palate offers apple custard and lemon curd flavors, held together with savory smoke and sea salt aspects.

title: Hawk and Horse Vineyards 2013 Sua Sponte Red (Napa Valley)
description: This small-production wine from the Lake County-based producer is made mostly of Petit Verdot, with 32% Cabernet Franc, 16% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon. Its concentrated blackberry fruit is accented with smoky oak and dusty tannin.

title: Heron Hill 2015 Eclipse White (New York)
description: This dry light-footed blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris offers zesty grapefruit and lemon flavors edged with white tea leaves. Balanced in alcohol, subtle and refreshing, it finishes on a clean, slightly mineral tone.

title: Hindsight 2014 20/20 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy red fruit defines this blend of 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 24% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Franc, 18% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot. Supportive tannins accent its cedar, oak and raisin notes.

title: Lundeen 2014 Winter's Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This single-vineyard cuvée is built upon own-rooted Pommard clone fruit, from vines that were planted in 1990. Scents and flavors of beet root, stem and herb poke through tart raspberry and pomegranate fruit. The mouthfeel is a bit stiff and tannic.

title: Jermann 2014 Where Dreams Have No End White (Venezia Giulia)
description: Toasted oak, hazelnut and fresh herb aromas carry over to the lean, linear palate, along with lemon drop, yellow apple and a confected notes. Crisp acidity lends a racy elegance.

title: Josh Cellars 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Easy to enjoy for its straightforward flavors and balance, this medium-bodied wine smells like black cherries and strawberries, tastes fruity and moderately rich and is also shaded by vanilla and maple, adding complexity and a touch of sweetness.

title: Pasini San Giovanni 2016  Lugana
description: Subtle orchard fruit and spring blossom aromas lift from the glass. On the vibrant, mouthwatering palate, fresh acidity underscores white peach, Bartlett pear and juicy citrus notes.

title: Höpler 2016 Pannonica Rosé (Weinland Österreich)
description: The faintest hint of red berry marks this wine's nose. Its palate, on the other hand, brims with zesty citrus. It's very light but also refreshing and dry, with enlivening spritz and citrus flavors.

title: Ideology 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Chocolate, cherry and coconut flavors make this mild-mannered wine inviting and luxurious. It shows soft tannin, plenty of toasted oak and a succulent finish.

title: Inama 2015 Vigneto du Lot  (Soave Classico)
description: Honey, chamomile, acacia and toasted oak aromas follow through to the palate, with yellow apple and a citrus drop flavors. A bitter almond note closes the finish. Drink soon to capture the remaining freshness and fruit.

title: Fossil Point 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Proving one of the more reliable affordably priced brands from the region, this bottling offers fresh jasmine, tangerine pith, crushed chalk and pineapple aromas. The palate is a bit more tropical, delivering coconut and mango flavors with enough restraint to please many.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Falanghina (Sannio)
description: Orange blossom, honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose. On the bright palate, tangy acidity carries white peach and citrus flavors while a hint of Mediterranean herb marks the close.

title: Fidelitas 2014 Champoux Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: This wine is 100% varietal coming from one of the top vineyards in the state. Reserved aromas of spice box, blackberry, barrel tones and gun smoke lead to elegantly styled fruit flavors. There are some interesting thing going on but they don't all come together at present.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2014 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Rose petal, red cherry and wild thyme scents show in this twist-top bottling from Kiler Canyon and Peachy Canyon vineyards, which is enhanced with 10% each of Mourvèdre and Counoise. Red spice and red berry flavors show on the palate, where zesty acidity cuts through chalky tannins.

title: Phelps Creek 2013 Reserve Syrah (Columbia Gorge (OR))
description: From a cool climate region, this brings crisp raspberry fruit with underlying minerality. Aging in one-third new French oak adds in notes of dusty coffee grounds and a hint of milk chocolate. The wine starts out tight, then fans out through the finish.

title: Markus Huber 2016 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: This wine's nose suggests fresh lemon. The palate adds green pear to that citrus notion, providing a light, zippy, easy-drinking body with a clean, dry finish.

title: Martinshof 2016 Gemischter Satz White (Niederösterreich)
description: A grassy hint of freshness accents this wine's ripe green and red apple-inflected nose. The palate is slightly dilute, but a touch of spritz and herbal spiciness make it fun and easy to drink. Fruit-driven and slender in body, it finishes refreshing and dry.

title: Mas de Cadenet 2016 Arbaude Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This soft wine has attractive red-berry flavors. They are given a lift by the bright acidity. It is a gentle wine, ideal for an apéritif with just the lightest tang at the end.

title: Giesen 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A solid two years after the vintage, this shows the concentration of 2015. Fig, melon and nectarine notes mingle easily on the nose and palate, where a touch of creaminess adds an extra dimension.

title: Le Vigne 2014 Cuore Della Vigna Red (Paso Robles)
description: This Super Tuscan-style blend named “heart of the vineyard” shows baked black raspberry, black plum, thyme and bay leaf on the nose. It's light in body on the energetic and easygoing palate, with a tangy raspberry snap.

title: Ledson 2013 Century Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Alicante Bouschet and aged for 20 months in French oak, this wine shows bright baked strawberry fruit that becomes brooding in the glass, layered with black licorice and peppered leather. Densely built, it finishes seductively smooth.

title: Lemelson 2014 Meyer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A light pretty wine, this brings a mix of strawberry and Bing cherry front and center. There's no real density or complexity; the fruit is fresh and clean and follows through in a light consistent finish.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2016 Les Papilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a delicious and fruity wine with attractive acidity and bright, ebullient character—it's just waiting for summer. The up-front red fruits and acidity are well in balance. This is ready to drink.

title: Lieb 2016 Bridge Lane Rosé (North Fork of Long Island)
description: While not as blossomy in perfume as previous vintages, there's plenty of fresh watermelon and sour-cherry refreshment here. Exceptionally light bodied and dry, it's an invigoratingly crisp summer sip. The finish is brisk but crystalline and mineral.
